column4: nick: how would you know what's child sensitive? we haven't invented a working pr0n filter yet
it's his call on what he calls 'child sensitive', not mine :)
wickedpuppy, it does work
I've added a bit to restricted formats, I know :)
added a bit?
about gstreamer0.8, and how to get all the plugins
ok, thanks, i hit that problem when i started with ubuntu and i couldn't find any info about it
rhythmbox errors are cryptic too
yeah, and who expects -mad to get mp3 support?
where did u add that info?
exactly :-(
especially as rhythmbox is installed by default (but almost useless without mp3 support)
shouldn't rhythmbox "recommend" those packages?
enable universe, multiverse, and apt-get install gstreamer0.8-plugins gstreamer0.8-plugins-multiverse
could be, I'm not apt enabled enough to know if that's a problem if universe and multverse are not enabled
i don't think it's a problem because recommends != requires
it just makes it easier to know what packages u should install
or perhaps some descriptive text in the package info?
that is the essence of the problem with all the non free stuff. How to recommend without potential liability. wiki vs actual dependencies, and I'm not qualified to speak on that
ianal but my guess is that only using a patented algorithm is illegal, not making it available or telling people they can/should use it
debian-legal is an interesting archive to browse ;)
if i had a few years :-)
